intro: Ulmus pedunculata, commonly known as the Chinese elm, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and heart-shaped leaves that turn yellow in autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by small, round fruits. It is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in a variety of soil types. Due to its adaptability and ornamental value, it is often planted in urban landscapes.
